intro: Bourreria wrightii, commonly known as Wright's burrgrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, followed by distinctive spiny capsules that contain the seeds. Bourreria wrightii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along streambanks.
